PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Onslaught X1 -- a cricket team predictor/retainer for IPL, Machine Learning, MIT
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
To predict the best players to retain based on previous year statistical data.  The 
Machine Learning model will be able to choose the best squad from a pool of available 
players given their recent performance statistics. The model predicts if a player would 
be selected based on his performance the previous year. The performance measure is 
depicted in the form of batting index and bowling index.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: BHEJ-DE -- Peer to Peer File Transfer, Computer Networks Project - MIT
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
The project dealt with P2P File transfer which was used to transfer any kind of files between two
clients. There was a server which maintained a database of files residing on all the clients
connected to it. Later, when a client requested for a file, the server would search its database
and send the client the IP Address of the client having the file. Later, the two clients establish a
connection and make the transfer and in the time being the server may serve other clients.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Needleman–Wunsch algorithm -- an algorithm for sequence alignment, A step towards parallel implementation, Parallel Computer Architecture and Programming Project - MIT
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
Needleman Wunsch algorithm is one of the widely accepted and used when it comes to the
optimality and correctness of the global sequence alignment. But as the size of the used sequences
increase, the algorithm becomes too slow and impractical to use. So the main scope of this project is
to parallelize the Needleman Wunsch algorithm so that it can reduce the computational time for
those long sequences and enhance the performance using high performance computing technology.
